00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantBRLMM.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Wed Feb 22 09:50:58 2006
00026  *
00027  * Implements a SNP genotype calling method motivated by Nusrat Rabbee's
00028  * RLMM (Robust Linear Model with Mahalanobis Distance Classifier) that utilizes
00029  * a Baysian prior about the centers of SNP clusters. Idea is to produce a
00030  * summary value for all probes that measure same genotype (default using RMA to
00031  * summarize) and then classify the genotype based on the relative intensity of
00032  * those estimates. For example in genotype AA the A probesets should be
00033  * relatively bright and B probesets should be relatively dim. For genotype AB
00034  * both probesets should be lighting up. Exactly how much intensity is expected
00035  * is learned from a random set of SNPs in the data using high confidence DM
00036  * calls as reference.
00037  *
00038  * For further information about RLMM see:
00039  * http://www.stat.berkeley.edu/users/nrabbee/RLMM/
00040  *
00041  *
00042  */
00043 /*
00044    We use floats to be compatible with R.
00045 
00046    Questions:
00047 
00048    - What happens in snp.clusterStats.R::clusterStats() when there are no
00049    genotypes observe? Looks like a bunch of NA's are passed back, what
00050    happens to them?
00051    - Couldn't calculate B summary values for SNP: AFFX-barcodeS
00052 */
00053 
00054 #ifndef QUANTBRLMM_H
00055 #define QUANTBRLMM_H
00056 
00057 #define QUANTBRLMM_VERSION "1.0"
00058

00074 #include <string>

00076 //

00080 #define asinh(x) (log(x+sqrt(x*x+1)))
00081 #endif

00083 /// String describing quant method
00084 #define QUANTBRLMM "brlmm"
00085 
00086 /**
00087  * Implements a SNP genotype calling method motivated by Nusrat Rabbee's
00088  * RLMM (Robust Linear Model with Mahalanobis Distance Classifier) that utilizes
00089  * a Baysian prior about the centers of SNP clusters. Idea is to produce a
00090  * summary value for all probes that measure same genotype (default using RMA to
00091  * summarize) and then classify the genotype based on the relative intensity of
00092  * those estimates. For example in genotype AA the A probesets should be
00093  * relatively bright and B probesets should be relatively dim. For genotype AB
00094  * both probesets should be lighting up. Exactly how much intensity is expected
00095  * is learned from a random set of SNPs in the data using high confidence DM
00096  * calls as reference.
00097  *
00098  * For further information about RLMM see:
00099  * http://www.stat.berkeley.edu/users/nrabbee/RLMM/
00100  */
00101 class QuantBRLMM : public QuantGTypeMethod {
00102 
00103 public:
00104 
00105   /// What transformation of intensity estimates to feed into classifier.
00106   enum Transformation {
00107     MvA, ///< Minus Vs Average
00108     RvT, ///< R vs Theta
00109     CES, ///< Contrast Extremes Stretch (previously known as south san francisco).
00110     CCS  ///< Contrast Centers Stretch (previously known as alternative south san francisco).
00111   };
00112 
00113   class BrlmmParam {
00114 
00115   public:
00116 
00117     BrlmmParam();
00118 
00119     double m_HetMultiplier;          ///< Number to balance het calls with to balance performance on het/hom calls.
00120     int m_Iterations;                ///< How many iterations to do of BRLMM, i.e. boostrapping from initial calls.
00121     double m_IterationThreshold;      ///< What is our threshold (maximum value) for confidences befor
00122                                      ///  calling 'NN' in iterative mode?
00123     double m_K;                      ///< Scaling Parameter to use in transformations.
00124     enum Transformation m_Transform; ///< What transformation of initial data are we feeding into the classifier?
00125     int m_PriorPseudoCount;          ///< How much weight should the prior get?
00126     int m_MinCluster;                ///< Minimum examples for each genotype to be included in prior estimation.
00127     bool m_LowPrecision;             ///< Summary values fed into R are usually truncated, should we do
00128                                      /// that to be compatible? (used for regression testss)
00129   };
00130 
00131

00134   QuantBRLMM(double hetMultiplier, int iterations, double iterationThreshold,
00135              double K, enum Transformation transform,
00136              int priorWeight, int priorMinCall, bool lowPrecision);

00258   /**
00259    * Remove the het cluster from a prior by setting center to be very
00260    * large negative number and removing covariance with other
00261    * clusters.
00262    * @param prior - Prior to remove het cluster from.
00263    * @param trans - transformation used for clustering.
00264    */
00265   void removeHetFromPrior(ClusterPrior &prior, enum Transformation trans);
00266 
00267   /**
00268    * This is the fix for the snps on chromosome X that don't appear
00269    * diploid in men (i.e. aren't in the pseudoautosomal region). The
00270    * concept is to fit and call the model separately for men and
00271    * women. Implementation is to set all the male initial calls to NN
00272    * when fitting for women. For fitting and calling men the female
00273    * samples are set to NN and further the prior is ajusted such that
00274    * het calls are impossible to get.
00275    */
00276   void callHaploidSnp(ClusterPrior &prior);

00281   /**
00282    * Transform the data in aValues and bValues using the method specified by trans.
00283    *
00284    * @param aValues - Summary values for A allele.
00285    * @param bValues - Summary values for B allele.
00286    * @param genoTypes - Genotypes for each sample.
00287    * @param Transformation - Type of transformation to use.
00288    * @param K - Scale parameter used in CCS and CES transformations.
00289    * @param xDim - two dimensional matrix for x dimension with rows
00290    * (index 0) being genotype (0,1,2) and columns being values observed.
00291    * @param yDim - two dimensional matrix for y dimension with rows
00292    * (index 0) being genotype (0,1,2) and columns being values observed.
00293    */

00297                                     std::vector<std::vector<double> > &xDim, std::vector<std::vector<double> > &yDim);

00360   /** 
00361    * Construct a prior from a collection of probesets. Note that to be part of
00362    * the prior a SNP must have at least 2 examples per AA, AB, and BB otherwise
00363    * the variance will be zero.
00364    * 
00365    * @param probeSets - ProbeSets to be used in computing prior.
00366    * @param layout - description and chip and probesets.
00367    * @param iMart - Cel file data for probesets.
00368    * @param iTrans - Transformers to operate on raw data (i.e. normalization and bg subtraction).
00369    * @param pmAdjust - Individual probe adjustment like pm-mm or pm-only.
00370    * 
00371    * @return - Prior constructed from summary of all the probesets.
00372    */
00373   ClusterPrior makePrior(       std::vector<string> &probeSetNames, 
00374                                 ChipLayout &layout,
00375                                 IntensityMart &iMart, 
00376                                 std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00377                                 PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
